verses.roman:
ity uktas taṁ parikramya
namaskṛtya punaḥ punaḥ
tat-pādau śīrṣṇy upādhāya
durmanāḥ prayayau purīm

synonyms: iti—thus; uktaḥ—spoken to; tam—Him; parikramya—circumambulating; namaḥ-kṛtya—offering obeisances; punaḥ punaḥ—again and again; tat-pādau—His lotus feet; śīrṣṇi—upon his head; upādhāya—placing; durmanāḥ—unhappy in his mind; prayayau—he went; purīm—to the city.
translation: Thus ordered, Dāruka circumambulated the Lord and offered obeisances to Him again and again. He placed Lord Kṛṣṇa's lotus feet upon his head and then with a sad heart went back to the city.
